__inputs.name: DS_K6
__inputs.label: k6
__inputs.description: InfluxDB 1.8 or InfluxDB 2 with v1 auth

description: A dashboard for visualizing results from the k6.io load testing tool, using the InfluxDB exporter. It supports http, ws, grpc, ... metrics

options.content:
### To choose which measurements to show, use the **Measurements** drop-down in the top left corner!

K6 collects metrics for several phases during the HTTP request lifetime.

The combined delays for the application and network (send, wait, recieve) are available in this metric:
  * **http_req_duration**       _( Total time for request, excluding time spent blocked (http_req_blocked), DNS lookup (http_req_looking_up) and TCP connect (http_req_connecting) time. )_

This metric can also be broken down into these metrics:
  * **http_req_tls_handshaking**     _( Time spent handshaking TLS session with remote host. )_
  * **http_req_sending**      _( Time spent sending data to remote host.  )_
  * **http_req_waiting**      _( Time spent waiting for response from remote host (a.k.a. "time to first byte", or "TTFB"). )_
  * **http_req_receiving**       _( Time spent receiving response data from remote host. )_

These metrics measure delays and durations on the client:

  * **http_req_blocked**     _( Time spent blocked (waiting for a free TCP connection slot) before initiating request.  )_
  * **http_req_looking_up**     _( Time spent looking up remote host name in DNS. )_
  * **http_req_connecting**     _( Time spent establishing TCP connection to remote host. )_


### View official K6.io documentation here: [https://docs.k6.io/docs/result-metrics][1]


[1]: https://docs.k6.io/docs/result-metrics

targets.query: SELECT count("value"), min("value"), median("value"), max("value"), mean("value"), percentile("value", 95) FROM /^$Measurement$/ WHERE ("name" =~ /^${URL:raw}$/ AND "scenario" =~ /^$scenario$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "name", "scenario", "group" fill(0)

SELECT count("value") as "sCount"  FROM /^${Measurement:regex}$/ WHERE ( "name" =~ /^${URL:raw}$/ AND "scenario" =~ /^${scenario:regex}$/ AND "value" <= ${T:raw}) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "name", "scenario" fill(0)

SELECT count("value")/2.0 as "tCount"  FROM /^${Measurement:regex}$/ WHERE ( "name" =~ /^${URL:raw}$/ AND "scenario" =~ /^$scenario$/ AND "value" > ${T:raw} AND "value" <= 4*${T:raw}) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "name", "scenario" fill(0)

SELECT max("value") AS "max", percentile("value", 99) AS "99%", percentile("value", 95) AS "95%", percentile("value", 90) AS "90%", percentile("value", 85) AS "85%", percentile("value", 80) AS "80%", percentile("value", 75) AS "75%", percentile("value", 50) AS "50%", percentile("value", 25) AS "25%", min("value") AS "min" FROM /^${Measurement:regex}$/ WHERE ("name" =~ /^${URL:raw}$/ AND "scenario" =~ /^$scenario$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

list.definition:
SELECT "scenario"
FROM
(SELECT last("value")
 FROM "${Measurement}"
 GROUP BY "scenario")
WHERE  $timeFilter
list.name: scenario
list.query:
SELECT "scenario"
FROM
(SELECT last("value")
 FROM "${Measurement}"
 GROUP BY "scenario")
WHERE  $timeFilter

list.definition:
SELECT "name"
FROM
(SELECT last("value")
 FROM "${Measurement}"
 WHERE "name" =~ /^${URL:raw}$/ AND "scenario" =~ /^${scenario:regex}$/
 GROUP BY "name")
WHERE $timeFilter
list.name: name
list.query:
SELECT "name"
FROM
(SELECT last("value")
 FROM "${Measurement}"
 WHERE "name" =~ /^${URL:raw}$/ AND "scenario" =~ /^${scenario:regex}$/
 GROUP BY "name")
WHERE $timeFilter

title: k6 Load Testing Results Simple filters
